have
not yet entirely strangled the holy curiosity of inquiry." A. Einstein

messages.subject: Bible questions
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/22/02 12:06:03 AM, bacwoodz@earthlink.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/22/02 12:06:03 AM, bacwoodz@... writes:

<< Why is it that the Bible says " call no man thy father, save thy father
which is in heaven" -(a meaning a father in spiritual leadership - and yet
we have the Holy Father - (I may have this title wrong) and various priests,
etc. who are called "Father so - and so"?
>>

If you're interested in internal and external logic problems involving
Christianity, here's a website for you.

http://www.skepticsannotatedbible.com/

There's a whole section with verses about families (marriages, children,
parents).

Sandra
